entities.name: EGYPT
entities.description: Ancient civilization where clothing was a symbol of status and identity, with the wealthy wearing elaborate garments and the common people simpler clothing

entities.name: GREECE
entities.description: Ancient civilization where clothing was a symbol of status and identity, with the wealthy wearing elaborate garments and the common people simpler clothing

entities.name: ROME
entities.description: Ancient civilization where clothing was a symbol of status and identity, with the wealthy wearing elaborate garments and the common people simpler clothing

entities.name: CATHOLIC CHURCH
entities.description: Institution that played a significant role in dictating appropriate attire during the Middle Ages through sumptuary laws

entities.name: RENAISSANCE
entities.description: Period of European history marked by a resurgence of interest in art, culture, and fashion, with the wealthy commissioning elaborate garments

entities.name: INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION
entities.description: Period in the 18th and 19th centuries that brought significant changes to the fashion industry through mass production and the rise of ready-to-wear clothing

entities.name: ROARING TWENTIES
entities.description: Period in the 1920s characterized by more relaxed and liberating clothing styles, with women embracing shorter hemlines and looser silhouettes

entities.name: GREAT DEPRESSION
entities.description: Economic downturn in the 1930s that led to a more conservative approach to fashion, with simple and practical designs reflecting the economic hardships of the time

entities.name: POST-WORLD WAR II ERA
entities.description: Period following World War II marked by prosperity and optimism, leading to a resurgence of glamour and luxury in fashion

entities.name: AUDREY HEPBURN
entities.description: Iconic fashion figure of the 1950s who popularized feminine and elegant styles

entities.name: MARILYN MONROE
entities.description: Iconic fashion figure of the 1950s who popularized feminine and elegant styles

entities.name: 1960S AND 1970S
entities.description: Period characterized by a spirit of rebellion and experimentation in fashion, influenced by youth culture

entities.name: 1980S AND 1990S
entities.description: Period marked by excess and opulence in fashion, with bold colors, exaggerated silhouettes, and flashy accessories

entities.name: CINDY CRAWFORD
entities.description: Supermodel of the 1980s and 1990s who helped popularize designer brands and high-end fashion labels

entities.name: NAOMI CAMPBELL
entities.description: Supermodel of the 1980s and 1990s who helped popularize designer brands and high-end fashion labels

entities.name: 21ST CENTURY
entities.description: Period marked by more diverse and inclusive fashion trends, with a greater emphasis on sustainability, diversity, and body positivity

entities.name: INSTAGRAM
entities.description: Social media platform that has revolutionized the way people discover and engage with fashion, with influencers and bloggers shaping trends

entities.name: TIKTOK
entities.description: Social media platform that has revolutionized the way people discover and engage with fashion, with influencers and bloggers shaping trends

entities.name: SUMPTUARY LAWS
entities.description: Laws during the Middle Ages that regulated what different classes of society could wear, influenced by the Catholic Church

entities.name: NOBLES AND ROYALTY
entities.description: Wealthy individuals during the Middle Ages and Renaissance who wore garments made from expensive fabrics like silk and velvet

entities.name: PEASANTS
entities.description: Common people during the Middle Ages who wore humble clothing made from rougher materials

entities.name: TALENTED DESIGNERS AND TAILORS
entities.description: Skilled individuals during the Renaissance who created elaborate garments for the wealthy elite

entities.name: PRINTING PRESS
entities.description: Invention that allowed for the widespread dissemination of fashion trends during the Renaissance through illustrated fashion plates and magazines

entities.name: DEPARTMENT STORES
entities.description: Retail establishments that emerged during the Industrial Revolution, making fashion more accessible to the general population

entities.name: FASHION MAGAZINES
entities.description: Publications that emerged during the Industrial Revolution, further democratizing fashion by allowing people to follow the latest trends

entities.name: READY-TO-WEAR CLOTHING
entities.description: Type of clothing that became more accessible to the general population during the Industrial Revolution due to mass production techniques

entities.name: MINI SKIRTS
entities.description: Fashion trend that became popular in the 1960s, reflecting a spirit of rebellion and experimentation

entities.name: BELL-BOTTOMS
entities.description: Fashion trend that became popular in the 1960s and 1970s, reflecting a spirit of rebellion and experimentation

entities.name: PSYCHEDELIC PRINTS
entities.description: Fashion trend that became popular in the 1960s and 1970s, reflecting a spirit of rebellion and experimentation

entities.name: SUPERMODELS
entities.description: High-profile models like Cindy Crawford and Naomi Campbell who helped popularize designer brands and high-end fashion labels in the 1980s and 1990s

entities.name: UPCYCLING
entities.description: Sustainable fashion practice that has gained traction in the 21st century, focusing on reusing and repurposing materials

entities.name: RECYCLING
entities.description: Sustainable fashion practice that has gained traction in the 21st century, focusing on reusing and repurposing materials

entities.name: ETHICAL SOURCING
entities.description: Sustainable fashion practice that has gained traction in the 21st century, focusing on ensuring fair labor practices and environmental responsibility
